id.description: A unique identifier for the object.

name.description: A descriptive name for the object.

type.description: The category or classification of the object, such as 'cell', 'organelle', etc.

attributes.description: A dictionary of key-value pairs representing the object's properties. Supports numbers, strings, booleans, arrays, or nested objects.

oneOf.description: A numerical attribute of the object.
A string attribute of the object.
A boolean attribute of the object (true/false).
An array of numbers, representing attributes such as dimensions or growth rates.
An array of strings, representing attributes like a list of genes.
An array of booleans, which could represent on/off states for multiple conditions.
A nested object, which can be used for complex structures like dictionaries or nested attributes.

boundary_conditions.description: Describes how different variables behave at the boundaries of the object. Supports custom user-defined variables.

type.description: The type of boundary condition, such as 'constant', 'varying', or 'gradient'.

value.description: The value assigned to the boundary, which could be a numerical limit or a string value.

behavior.description: The behavior of the boundary, such as 'reflective', 'periodic', or 'diffusive'.

contained_object_types.description: A list of nested objects that are contained within this object, such as organelles within a cell.

description: This schema defines an object, including its attributes, boundary conditions, and any contained objects. It supports a variety of data types and structures, allowing flexibility in defining biological entities.
